WorkItem.Description:
Affected Version: 2.2.15
 
There are a few gems that don't show the correct stats in Rawr:
 
Timeless Dark Jade
Perfect Timeless Dark Jade
Timeless Forest Emerald
Timeless Eye of Zul
 
The stats show up correctly on both the Armory and Wowhead. I updated the item cache from the Armory, and the correct stats are still not shown in Rawr.
 
Timeless Dark Jade:
http://www.wowarmory.com/item-info.xml?i=39968
http://www.wowhead.com/?item=39968
 
Perfect Timeless Dark Jade:
http://www.wowarmory.com/item-info.xml?i=41479
http://www.wowhead.com/?item=41479
 
Timeless Forest Emerald:
http://www.wowarmory.com/item-info.xml?i=40085
http://www.wowhead.com/?item=40085
 
Timeless Eye of Zul:
http://www.wowarmory.com/item-info.xml?i=40164
http://www.wowhead.com/?item=40164

Comments.Message: I just checked in v2.2.18 and the problem is not fixed. All four of the gems I listed show stamina, but not intellect.

It's showing correct data now



** Closed by Jothay 9/17/2009 11:45 AM
(I didn't see the re-open link when I added a comment just now. Please see that comment.)
How are you checking? What model are you looking at them in? Or are you using the item editor? It sounds like you're just using an item that doesn't consider int as relevant.

From the main window, right click a piece of gear and select "Equip Custom Gemming..." from the menu.
Left click one of the gem slots and the list of gems appears. Find any of the four gems I listed in the original issue description and hover over them. The intellect does not show up. Other gems do show intellect.

I did not check every gem available for accuracy; these are just 4 that I noticed as having missing information.
What model are you looking at them in? It sounds like you're just using a model that doesn't consider int as relevant.

I supposed I misunderstood what you were saying. I was looking at the in the ProtPaladin model. When I first reported this issue, other gems were showing the intellect. Now, none of them seem to.

I think stats that aren't considered relevant should still be shown, *or* it should be made clear that the "irrelevant" stats are not being shown. People do have reasons for using gems with stats that Rawr might not consider relevant.

But those reasons are usually given by people who are either BAD players who don't know what their doing or they are trying to use Rawr for something it's not intended for (like leveling, or PvP).

As it stands, I thought Intellect was relevant in the ProtPaladin model, but if it isn't, that doesn't mean the items are showing the wrong info.... closing issue as this isn't the actual issue, if you wanna open another one stating Intellect should be marked as relevant to ProtPaladin and STATE WHY, we'll take a look at it
